• Clinicians should have a low threshold for investigating pregnant or recently delivered (up to 6 months postpartum)
women, especially those with cardiovascular risk factors (hypertension, diabetes), suspected rheumatic heart
disease or with symptoms such as shortness of breath or chest pain.
